column4: Replace kgcc with the command required for compiling kernels you can specify the correct one with command (in bash): export CC=kgcc
Which is the correct one in ubuntu?
ehrm, please don't compile the kernel yourself
robertj I was following thishttp://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=53755&highlight=logitech+webcam
ah, you aren't compiling the kernel :)
cat /proc/version
what does that say?
welcome back: Result of cat /proc/version Linux version 2.6.10-2-686 (buildd@terranova) (gcc version 3.3.5 (Debian 1:3.3.5-6ubuntu1)) #1 Thu Jan 27 13:39:43 UTC 2005
hmm, you should update that kernel
no, just apt-get upgrade
just install linux-686 - that will keep you up-to-date all the time
paste your /etc/apt/sources.list on the pastebin please
apt-get update && apt-get upgrade
and also: please use an official mirror
For a ready-to-use sources.list with all official Ubuntu repositories, go to paste.ubuntulinux.nl/969
Still getting the same error :(
but did the kernel upgrade?
apt-get install linux-686 linux-686 is already the newest version.
did you change your sources.list and run apt-get update?
hmm, quickcams suck even more than I thought :)
apt-get install linux-source-2.6.10-2
then you have it already :)
